description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.

Within the Android Wear team, you will be managing a highly cross-functional and cross-site development team and work closely with software engineers, test engineers, product managers and partners to get high-quality products and new features built, tested, and released on time. You will coordinate lots of fast-changing, moving parts and still get them to come together as a product. You'll need excellent communication skills to be the go-to person for all questions about release schedules, technical issues, quality and progress updates.

You will be responsible for identifying and managing risks, making sound judgments about quality and stopping (or speeding up) production at the right time.

Making the world's information universally accessible and useful doesn't stop at the desktop. The Mobile team builds tools to get you the information you need no matter where you are. Android has become the world's most popular mobile ecosystem, powering billions of devices, from smartphones to tablets, watches to TVs and everything in between. Whether adding to the core Android experience, forging new markets for digital content, creating immersive and portable versions of our products or managing relationships with a global community of developers, the Mobile team is giving you Google on the go.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or a related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4 years of experience as a Software Engineer in a relevant technical domain.
  • 1 year of experience as a Program Manager, Project Manager or Engineering Manager.
  • Experience working with memory constraints, battery life constraints, chipset software, and chipset firmware.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
  • 6 years of relevant experience, including 4 years of industry experience in managing large, complex projects
  • Experience in external partner or vendor management.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving and organizational skills.
  • Adept at leading teams of highly talented, independent individuals with a track record of quickly earning credibility based on your knowledge.
  • Deep technical knowledge of the Android platform and ecosystem.
responsibilities:
• Manage technical projects or programs, working closely with Google engineers to understand and drive technical investigations to closure.
  • Coordinate cross-functional and cross-site development and manage communication of progress and status within the core team and with external partners.
  • Develop processes to improve software engineering productivity (internal- and external-facing).
  • Develop a plan and schedule with well-defined milestones and track progress towards it; escalate issues as necessary.
  • Monitor, prioritize and triage incoming bugs.
title: Technical Program Manager, Android Wear
